intro: Micrechites brachypetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petaled rockcress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and features simple, alternate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
